body: Ask yourselves this question all you NFL die hards, If you had the power to, would you make the super bowl a national holiday (in the U.S)? I thought this would be a fun question 4 y'all to answer. Enjoy :PP
body_tagged: Ask yourselves this question all you NFL die hards, If you had the power to, would you make the super bowl a national holiday (in the U.S)? I thought this would be a fun question 4 y'all to answer. Enjoy :PP
title: Super Bowl Holiday?

replies.body: No. Not everyone likes American football. But it sure as hell izjust4fun to play. (Ok he's Canadian, whatever)
replies.body_tagged: No. Not everyone likes American football. But it sure as hell izjust4fun to play. (Ok he's Canadian, whatever)

replies.body: I don't follow or watch football, but yeah I would make it a holiday just so I can skip school.
replies.body_tagged: I don't follow or watch football, but yeah I would make it a holiday just so I can skip school.

replies.body: Why would some sporting event possibility require a day off of work/school?

replies.body: The Super Bowl is on a Sunday xP.  But considering that people wait all year and these business must pay millions of dollars to get a commercial spot, it sounds like a holiday already.

replies.body: In america we treat every sunday like a holiday. Everyone stops working (mostly) and sits down and watches football. It's just our pastime. Well that's what I do :PPPP
replies.body_tagged: In america we treat every sunday like a holiday. Everyone stops working (mostly) and sits down and watches football. It's just our pastime. Well that's what I do :PPPP

replies.body: In America, The Super Bowl is a holiday (And a Sunday), and the only time my mom will play ads on the TV without muting them. :)

replies.body: Well, if the Super Bowl became a holiday, the World Series would have to also! Baseball is our National Pastime, and there's no denying thay.

replies.body:
@SnowSX3, American football can have crazy turn outs, this past weekend showed the lucky team (Seattle) And the dominant team (New England). Personally I want the Patriots to win. Tom Brady is a native to my area and I would like to see him win. The neon and blue is getting a bit too overwhelming. 

@RCMP: Dude the packers had this one. They made some pretty stupid decisions when it came to instances where 4th and inches occurred. From my point of view, the Seahawks were just lucky, the better team just made one error. New England has this. The Broncos had no chance, but this time around the score will not be as huge!

replies.body: it's honestly not that bad of a decision when you realize you're going against a good defense... gotta get points when you can... the seahawks are a good defense, it'd have been a huge momentum shift if they stuffed the packers on those fourth downs..
